Note the red dot in the figure, you can see that in the state C,$P_{C}=3	imes10^{5}P_{a}$ and $V_{C}=2	imes10^{-3}m^{3}$
Note the red dot in the figure, you can see that in the state A,$P_{A}=1	imes10^{5}P_{a}$ and $V_{A}=6	imes10^{-3}m^{3}$
According to the ideal gas equation of state $ rac{P_{A}V_{A}}{T_{A}}= rac{P_{C}V_{C}}{T_{C}}$, $T_{C}=300k$ can be obtained

From A to C, the volume of the gas decreases, and the outside world does positive work on the gas, and the area enclosed by the p-V plot line and the horizontal axis can be obtained $W= rac{(p_B+p_C)\quad(V_B-V_C)}{2}=1000\mathrm{~J}$

Since $T_{A}=T_{C}$, the internal energy of the gas in states A and C is equal, thus $\Delta U=0$. According to the first law of thermodynamics, $\Delta U=W+Q$, it can be deduced that $\mathrm{Q=-1000J}$
